EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Engagement Letter (1354901635.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Deb, Just left you a voicemail about this, I think we could just add our our standard agreement <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Exec_MSA_Template.pdf> and statement of work <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Exec_SOW.pdf> and work it in to the proposal by saying something like. This engagment will be processed by MBO Partners (maybe ad this page <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_Introduction.pdf> too so they know what we do.) Thanks,Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Debra McReavy [mailto:debra.mcreavy@att.net] Sent: Thursday, December 06, 2012 3:27 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Engagement Letter Sara, This client has asked me for the engagement letter and any “contracting terms”. What do we want added in here? Debra McReavy, R.N.Turning Leaf Healthcare ConsultingPO Box 593St. Albans, MO 63073 Cell: (636) 346-7050Visit me on the web at: turningleafhealthcare.com Debra.McReavy@att.net <mailto:Debra.McReavy@att.net>
